columns.text: The problem will require us to compute the total asset turnover.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

* Internal growth rate is 7.1%.
* The dividend payout ratio is 25%.
* Profit Margin is 6.5%
* The firm uses no external financing.

### Requirement.

### Compute the total asset turnover.

Total asset turnover is the ratio and measurement of every dollar in assets.

### Compute the retention ratio.

The problem is silent to the retained earnings and net income. To compute the retention ratio, we will use the given dividend payout ratio. The dividend payout ratio is converted to a decimal value.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= 1 -\text{Dividend Payout Ratio}\\[15pt]

&= 1 - 0.25 \\[15pt]

&= 0.75 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{75\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the retention ratio is **75%**.

### Compute the ROA (return on assets).

The return on assets can be derived using the given internal growth rate.

The formula for the internal growth rate is as follows.


$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Internal Growth Rate}&= \text{ROA} \times \text{Retention Ratio} \\[15pt]

\end{aligned}
$$

### Derive the formula of ROA from the procedure of internal growth rate.

The ROA formula can be derived from the formula of internal growth rate. It is calculated by dividing internal growth from the retention ratio.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{ROA}&= \dfrac{\text{Internal Growth Rate}}{\text{Retention Ratio}}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{7.1\%}{75\%}\\[15pt]

&=0.0947 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{9.47\%}}



\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the return on asset rate is **9.47%**.
